headline: Excelitas Appoints Lynn Swann to Board of Directors
summary: PITTSBURGH, June 25, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Excelitas®, a leading provider of advanced, life-enriching technologies that make a difference, serving global market leaders in the life sciences, advanced industrial, next-generation semiconductor and avionics sectors, today announced the appointment of Lynn Swann to its Board of Directors. A celebrated business leader, broadcaster and former professional athlete, Swann brings a wealth of business acumen, leadership experience and public service to

headline: NJ state budget proposes tax hike on online betting, NJ.com reports
summary: New Jersey Governor Phil Murphy and legislative leaders are finalizing a deal on a new state budget that would include tax hikes on cigarettes, luxury homes, and online gaming, but not on bowling, batting cages, and laser tag, as originally proposed, NJ Advance Media’s Brent Johnson reported for NJ.com. The deal between the governor and lawmakers includes a “less than 20% tax” on both online sports betting and iGaming, the report noted. Publicly traded companies in the betting space include Boyd

content.title: NJ state budget proposes tax hike on online betting, NJ.com reports
content.summary: New Jersey Governor Phil Murphy and legislative leaders are finalizing a deal on a new state budget that would include tax hikes on cigarettes, luxury homes, and online gaming, but not on bowling, batting cages, and laser tag, as originally proposed, NJ Advance Media’s Brent Johnson reported for NJ.com. The deal between the governor and lawmakers includes a “less than 20% tax” on both online sports betting and iGaming, the report noted. Publicly traded companies in the betting space include Boyd

headline: Caesars Palace Times Square Partners with Rev. Al Sharpton and Ryan Williams, Founder of Cadre, on Historic Inclusive Ownership Opportunities for U.S. Gaming
summary: NEW YORK, June 25, 2025--Caesars Palace Times Square today announced its partnership with Reverend Al Sharpton and Ryan Williams, founder of one of the leading global digital real estate investment platforms, Cadre, to pursue a historic inclusive ownership model for U.S. gaming. Caesars Palace Times Square is the bid from SL Green Realty Corp, Caesars Entertainment, and Roc Nation to bring a state-of-the-art gaming and entertainment destination to 1515 Broadway in Times Square.

content.title: Caesars Palace Times Square Partners with Rev. Al Sharpton and Ryan Williams, Founder of Cadre, on Historic Inclusive Ownership Opportunities for U.S. Gaming

Caesars Palace Times Square is the bid from SL Green Realty Corp, Caesars Entertainment, and Roc Nation to bring a state-of-the-art gaming and entertainment destination to 1515 Broadway in Times Square.
